source.86447141:
from kaggle_environments import make
env = make("lux_ai_2021", configuration={"seed": 1, "loglevel": 2, "annotations": True, "width": 12, "height": 12}, debug=True)
PATH_TO_MAIN_PY_FILE_FOR_BOT = "Lux-Design-2021/kits/js/simple/main.py"
steps = env.run([PATH_TO_MAIN_PY_FILE_FOR_BOT, PATH_TO_MAIN_PY_FILE_FOR_BOT])
env.render(mode="ipython", width=1200, height=800)
source.3f9a47e0:
Now let's try and run a single match. Replace the bot paths with the path to the `main.py` files of the bots

Ideally, if you implemented the exact same `simple` bot as the official starter kits (e.g. Javascript, Python), then your bot should run completely symmetrically in the following game, and each city ends with a total city fuel of 6930 with about 126.89% of wood collected by both teams.
source.5a963cf3:
# Testing new non-python starter kits

To make sure a kit will work on kaggle servers, please follow the instructions in this notebook. 

There are two ways, you can either download any build tools, compile here, then try and run a match and see if it works.
Or upload a file that you compiled locally. If it works, then great!

Please make a copy of this notebook and publish it so the Lux AI team can see!
source.2b32606b: Change the number below to your particular PR number

## Step 1: Method 2 - Compile locally, Upload

First, upload your bot by clicking add data, add custom "dataset" and upload your .tar.gz submission file.

Now untar and unzip your file
